intro: Schubertia grahamii, commonly known as Graham's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, and it has hairy, succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. Schubertia grahamii is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to dry climates. It is a perennial herb that blooms from spring to early summer.
